{"rule":"SPACE_BEFORE_PARENTHESIS","sentence":"^\\Q{{< katex display=true >}} \\begin{aligned} Score(QF,QR) = \\log &P(match | Observed(match|mismatch), QF, QR) - \\\\ & \\log P(mismatch | Observed(match|mismatch), QF, QR) \\end{aligned} {{< /katex >}}\\E$"}
{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\Q{{< katex display=true >}} \\begin{aligned} Gap\\,Penalty = Score(40,40 | Observed(mismatch)) \\times GapWeigth \\end{aligned} {{< /katex >}}\nLeft and right alignment\\E$"}
{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\Q{{< obi obipairing >}} uses a gap penalty estimated as the score of a mismatch between two nucleotides with a quality score of 40, scaled by a constant value (GapWeight).\\E$"}
{"rule":"COMMA_PARENTHESIS_WHITESPACE","sentence":"^\\Q{{< katex display=true >}} \\begin{aligned} Gap\\,Penalty = Score(40,40 | Observed(mismatch)) \\times GapWeigth \\end{aligned} {{< /katex >}}\nLeft and right alignment\\E$"}

{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\Q\\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q : Number of kmer shared on the main diagonal of the fasta dot plot({{< relref \"fasta-like#dotplot\" >}}).\\E$"}
{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\Q\\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q : The pairing fast score is the number of shared 4mer on the main diagonal of the fasta dot plot({{< relref \"fasta-like#dotplot\" >}}) (\\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q) by the number of 4mer involved in the overlapping region of the reads ({{< katex >}}paring\\_fast\\_overlap - 3{{< /katex >}}) {{< katex  display=true >}} paring\\_fast\\_score = \\frac{paring\\_fast\\_count}{paring\\_fast\\_overlap - 3} {{< /katex >}}\\E$"}

{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\Q{{< katex display=true >}} \\begin{aligned} Score(QF,QR) = \\log &P(match | Observed(match|mismatch), QF, QR) - \\\\ & \\log P(mismatch | Observed(match|mismatch), QF, QR) \\end{aligned} {{< /katex >}}\\E$"}

{"rule":"UNLIKELY_OPENING_PUNCTUATION","sentence":"^\\Q}}\\E$"}

{"rule":"COMMA_PARENTHESIS_WHITESPACE","sentence":"^\\Q{{< fig-svg title=\"Aligning paired reads with an amplicon longer than the read\" caption=\"When two paired reads are aligned to recover a full amplicon that is longer than the reads (blue rectangle), it defines two flanking regions (red rectangles) that are not aligned and correspond to the 5' ends of the reads, and an overlap region (green rectangle) at the 3' ends of the reads that must be aligned.\" height=\"200\" width=\"330\"\n}}   .arrow { stroke: black; stroke-width: 2; fill: none; } .arrow-head { stroke: black; stroke-width: 2; fill: black; } .text { font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; fill: black; } .label { font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10px; fill: black; }\\E$"}

{"rule":"DASH_RULE","sentence":"^\\Q{{< katex display=true >}}Q_{consensus} = \\log_{10} \\left(10^{-\\frac{Q_max}{10}} \\cdot \\frac{1 - 10^{-\\frac{Q_min}{10}}}{4} \\right){{< /katex >}}\nAt an insertion or deletion, the gap is affected of a quality of 0 and the mismatch rules are applied.\\E$"}
{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\Qali_dir: indicates the mode of the used exact alignment left or right.\\E$"}

{"rule":"UPPERCASE_SENTENCE_START","sentence":"^\\Qseq_a_single: The length of the unaligned region on the forward read.\\E$"}
{"rule":"UPPERCASE_SENTENCE_START","sentence":"^\\Qali_length: The length of the aligned overlapping region (including gaps).\\E$"}
{"rule":"UPPERCASE_SENTENCE_START","sentence":"^\\Qseq_ab_match: The number of matches in the aligned overlapping region.\\E$"}
{"rule":"UPPERCASE_SENTENCE_START","sentence":"^\\Qscore: The row score of the alignment (the sum of the elementary scores for each aligned position({{< relref \"exact-alignment#scoring-system\">}})).\\E$"}
{"rule":"UPPERCASE_SENTENCE_START","sentence":"^\\Qseq_b_single: The length of the unaligned region on the reverse read.\\E$"}
{"rule":"UPPERCASE_SENTENCE_START","sentence":"^\\Qscore_norm: \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q divided by \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-|Dummy-|Maniquí-|Maniquíes-)[0-9]+\\Q.\\E$"}
{"rule":"UPPERCASE_SENTENCE_START","sentence":"^\\Qpairing_mismatches`: A description of the mismatches between the reads.\\E$"}
{"rule":"DASH_RULE","sentence":"^\\Q{{< katex display=true >}}Q_{consensus} = \\log_{10} \\left(10^{-\\frac{Q_max}{10}} \\cdot \\frac{1 - 10^{-\\frac{Q_min}{10}}}{4} \\right){{< /katex >}}\nIn case of an insertion or a deletion, the gap will be affected with a quality of 0 and the mismatch rules will be applied.\\E$"}
{"rule":"DASH_RULE","sentence":"^\\Q{{< katex display=true >}}Q_{consensus} = \\log_{10} \\left(10^{-\\frac{Q_max}{10}} \\cdot \\frac{1 - 10^{-\\frac{Q_min}{10}}}{4} \\right){{< /katex >}}\nIn case of an insertion or deletion, the gap will be affected with a quality of 0 and the mismatch rules will be applied.\\E$"}
{"rule":"YOUR","sentence":"^\\QIt's on your responsability in a second time to remove the sequences you don't want based on these tags and your filtering rules\nA filtering mode, where sequence considered as spurious sequences by obiclean are removed from the data set/\\E$"}
